reviews.text: My husband and I absolutely love going here. It is such a quaint place and a wonderful piece of history. They have amazing food. Great staff and a nice cozy atmosphere. A definite destination when visiting downtown Fredericksburg.

I had the 1/3 pound cheeseburger. It was properly cooked and seasoned very well. The seating was a bit tight but I was with a large party. The decor is very "hole in the wall" ish. It is super out dated but you don't come here for the decor, you come for the delicious food which is incredibly priced, and a super friendly staff that is knowledgeable and helpful. I would definitely go back just because the value dollar for dollar and the staff.
The food was amazing. Full of flavor and tasted perfect. Cozy place, and when you walk in it takes you back in time!! Baklava is fabulous

Went for lunch. Very good food...nice service. The manager even joked with us.
Here was the Specials today.
No matter what I order, the food is always cooked to perfection. Very reasonable prices for one of the landmarks in the Fredericksburg area. Nice family atmosphere.
One of the best place to grab some snacks since the people working here move fast so there is less wait time. perfect for take out
Good food and the service was the best I've seen in a long time. Will be going more!
I always get breakfast and it’s always fantastic. Hard to find good grits but they nail it every time! Great staff and good service.
Loved this place.  Great food...great prices.  Staff is super NICE!
The breakfast was great, and the service was awesome

I had a delicious latte with very nice latte art. Impressive. I asked because I had been practicing (and sucking) at making designs. It was probably the best latte I've ever had. Visually pleasing too. Highly recommend! A friend had a soy mocha frappe. He gave the edge to Starbucks (but compared to the full fat/flavor version).

This is a nice coffee shop for meeting a friend. I think the attraction is it's downtown location, and the atmosphere feels unique - kinda hipster but it's a local favorite, and been in business for years, so it must have something going for it. I think it's good, but the seating can be uncomfortable, and it's a little odd. Pretty typical for a one off coffee shop, though. Always some outdoor seating, and water bowl for your dog.
Hyperion has a very good macchiato and their seasonal menu items always delight. Also, looking for the perfect pastry to top it all off? Get the tea cake heated. You won't be disappointed.

Go here almost every single day of the week even though I work at a different coffee shop! The white mocha with whip is my go to! Atmosphere and service is always super solid! The French apple square is also a very solid choice for a snack if you a wee hungry!
The coffee is wonderful!!! The customer service not so much. If the barista's don't know you personally they barely smile or speak.
I ordered Guinness soup and it was delicious! Rich deep flavors and tons of carrots, potatoes, and beef.  Waitress was pleasant. :-)  It was a Tuesday afternoon so it was very quiet.

Fair.  Just fair.  My girlfriend got the Fish and Chips, which was "award winning" (Maybe years ago).  Fish was overcooked and basic Sysco grade.  I got the Shepherds Pie, it was quite good though.  The staff was attentive.  It was a Sunday night, so the joint was deader than John Candy.  I was looking to do some drinking, but just couldn't get in the mood.
Best Irish pub in town by far.  The best burger in town, too.  Friendly staff, great music, and really just a fun place all around!  I always leave with a smile.
Always a great time. Food is good, especially the burgers-might be the best in town. If you're looking for a perfect pour at a bar that's not obnoxious..look no farther.
The music was not the kind I want to listen to in an Irish pub. The entertainer played very few Irish songs. The Guinness was good.

So, yesterday, after enjoying our Free Ice Cream Cone at Ben & Jerry's, me and my friends headed over to the Hard Times Cafe for dinner.  Now, we had eaten there before, a long time ago, and we were looking forward to our meal.  First off, the staff was friendly and welcoming.  The waiter asked, right off the bat, if we wanted separate checks - which was nice because we did.  The cafe wasn't too busy, it was a little after 7 PM, so there was no waiting.
I had the 5-way Chili Mac with Veggie Chili and a Diet Coke.  They started us out with corn bread after serving us our drinks and our food was served pretty quickly and was tasty.  Afterwards, even though I shouldn't have, I ordered a Reese's Peanut Butter Pie.  To be honest I was full but the dessert menu looked so good!  And the pie was perfect - with whipped cream and some chocolate syrup. 
Overall the price wasn't that bad either, even including the tip.  I have to say the Hard Times Cafe is one of those places where you CAN visit it a few times a season without worrying about your wallet and just enjoy the food.  Also, it is far enough away from the Waterfront NOT to be too crowded or filled with tourists.  But it also means it is close to the King Street Station when you need to get back home via one of the buses or the subway.  As we all had to get home via public transport it was nice that we were served so quickly and were so close to the station.  Yet, we never felt rushed!  I wish I could give them more stars - I have been to a few Hard Times Cafe and have NEVER been disappointed.

This is a pretty simple little place. It's a chain, or it used to be. Most or all of the other locations have closed. They serve Tex-Mex bar food, mainly chili. They have four kinds of chili, including vegetarian. They also serve Shiner Bock beer from Texas. The servers are all very nice and helpful. Good for a quick bite or a relaxing beer. The chili, cheese and spaghetti 3-way is filling, but could do with a little less spaghetti and more chili and cheese.

Great flavors of chili. Texas, Cincinnati, red Texas, and vegetarian. We loved them all. The homemade cornbread was delicious. The only thing I would have liked better were the beans to be cooked longer. They were too hard when biting into them. I had the five-way chili. Absolute delicacy!

I understand that it has been around for quite some time but the place just feels dark and dirty and not in a cool dive bar kind of way.  Had their chili (Texas style not their signature one) it was ok.  Not unhappy but not excited about going back either
This place has truly awesome chili choices! They also serve a bowl of water tots with chili, cheese, and sour cream... Oh my gosh, so good!

Great place. I'd recommend to anyone. This place has always catered to the vegetarian crowd and has a lot if options if that's your thing. They have plenty of other options as well. The nachos are great. I love the camper special. Good burgers. Killer grilled cheese. Nice atmosphere.

Wow. We came here for lunch and were greeted by a very friendly waitress named Kate. Once we sat down she immediately noticed we were considering the vegan options and she was very helpful with guiding us around the menu. 

The food came out in a timely manner despite the place being absolutely packed. My beer was at my table 60 seconds after ordering it. The food is top notch, the daily specials are fresh and delightful, and the classic menu items hold their place for a reason. 

Come try this spot, you won't regret it. If you're a vegan, request Kate, she's got your back.

I am so happy I finally got to go here. Jeffery was our waiter(also happened to be the bar tender) and he was fantastic. Was quick with our orders and anything we needed. Food was delicious and I love that they have vegetarian, vegan and gluten free options.

Best most freshest food with great service. Very clean restaurant with the friendliest people. My first experience there was amazing and I will be back soon. The only thing I didn't see was high chairs. But overall the best place to eat.

We were visiting on a whim from Richmond and found this gem to eat at. The vegan options are great! I’m so happy they have quite a few options. I loved the atmosphere here and the people. My server was amazing and had a constant smile o her face. Either way, I’m sure no matter what you get it will be enjoyable. Will come again next visit!

Went to dinner with my lady and informed the chef that I’m on a diet and can’t eat rice. He smiled and said not to worry. He made something special that was absolutely amazing!!!! Great place to go!!!

Umi is the best sushi place in Fredericksburg.  I've always had excellent service when dining here and especially when I'm at the bar.  The place looks great and they have plenty of options outside of sushi.  The sushi is fresh, excellent quality, and good variety.

My go-to spot in all of Fredericksburg. Consistently fresh and delicious food, and friendly efficient staff. I absolutely love their sushi, but everything I've tried there has been exceptional, even something as standard as fried rice.

Always a delight to go to this great little restaurant. Excellent sushi and Japanese food-the tempura is top-notch! Lunchtime bento boxes are worth the drive, so don't put off a visit any time of day.

We've made Umi a mandatory stop on our visits to Fredericksburg. Outstanding sushi, artfully prepared, and served at just the right temperature. Staff is courteous, prompt and attentive, but not overly so. Umi's is primarily a sushi restaurant and offers some other Asian inspired dishes, so we ordered sushi. We ordered a number of sushi dishes and were AMAZED. They had three sushi chef's making wonderful dish after wonderful dish. We couldn't stop eating, it was so good. This one is a can't miss if you like sushi.

I've been wanting to go here for over a year and we finally got to go on Sunday for brunch. I was told it was under new management but the menu still looked delightful so we took a shot. To say the wait staff was slow is beyond an understatement. We waited almost 15 minutes just to get menus. We didn't get our drinks for 20 more minutes.  We were at the restaurant for over an hour before we got our food. A couple that was there before us actually left without eating because of the wait. The food was OK. The potatoes were under cooked and very greasy. The brie appetizer was delicious but being that all they did was heat it up and drip some honey on it, I can't really give them props for that. My husbands vegetable frittata had good flavor but was a bit under cooked. I had a steak and cheese omelet. A bit on the greasy side but decent flavor. Needless to say, we won't be going back but I hope they get their act together and are able to handle the people who do show up, otherwise they won't stay in business long.

Just ate here tonight - 3-29-14.
We arrived for dinner with a reservation for 7pm for a party of eight.   Well we certainly did not need a reservation as we were the only customers coming in.  One other party of six came in thirty minutes later.  Menu looked good, I had the surf and turf - Tenderloin with crab cake - steak was cooked to my liking but the crab cake was nothing great.  One person in our party had to send back their fish to be cooked some more - apologies from the staff.  Others in the party had seafood as well and indicated that it was not cooked to their liking.  Wine list is extremely limited.  I thought this was an expensive lesson in where not to eat dinner!  Fredericksburg has many other restaurants that are much more enjoyable!  My recommendation is pass on Jake & Mikes!
Probably the best food in town.  Plenty of choices on the menu and a friendly staff to go with it.  Highly recommended.

I had a grilled cheese with bacon and tomatoes and my date had the bruschetta with tomato soup. Both dishes were excellent and the locally grown tomatoes really stood out on the bruschetta. Vale was excellent
I come here everytime i'm in town. So amazing! Love the roasted garlic and tomato bisque. I get that everytime I go, so good!

Very nice selection of beer, great cocktails, food Presentation was excellent. Our server was a very nice and friendly young girl, she really made us feel welcome. One of the nicest restaurants i have found in Fredericksburg VA. I would definitely go back and recommend it to friends. My friend got married here this weekend, and the restaurant staff and food were outstanding!! The scallops were especially delicious, but I also recommend the cocktails. I had a decaf coffee and that was very tasty (came with French press). Highly recommended for special events. The manager was very friendly and accommodating. We will be back!

This place has always been a delight to visit.  The drinks are wonderful, the service is great and the food is always on point!  I have been a visitor for quite a few years now and haven't had a bad time at this establishment!
Finally made it to this restaurant. Pretty nice meal. Kinda trendy.. a little taken aback by canned seafood on the menu but enjoyed the scallops. Nice atmosphere great service.
Absolutely fabulous food! Incredibly fresh oysters. I had the rack of lamb and he had the 36 hour pork, perfectly prepared with great veg :) the cocktails are delicious but too small ;)
The food is great and the service is excellent. Be prepared for a higher bill and smaller portions, because this is a fancy shmancy place for folks who like to get quality over quantity.

We went to celebrate our anniversary and read reviews before we got there to know what to order. I had the lobster bisque which was delicious but very spicy. The prime rib was good and also the stuffed mushrooms. But the music was loud and awful- like you'd hear in a bar; random shuffle of 90's rock music. When we told the manager/owner, the answer we got was that young people said slow music made them sleepy....?? We were surprised young people could afford to go here- we saw three couples leave after glancing at the menu in the 1.5 hrs we were there.

Old Town Steak And Seafood is the best place in Fredericksburg to have a great dinner. It maybe a little expensive, but the quality of the food matches it. We love their food. They have the best scallops I have ever eaten anywhere. Their desserts are to die for. You need to try it.

We celebrated our 37th anniversary March 20 with excellent food served by a very friendly and professional fellow named Matt. Our original dining choice had no open reservations and we are so glad. It was an evening to remember and we can't wait to come back with our children and friends.  
.
Love this place I grew up eating here on special occasions and I still like to. Owners are so sweet make you feel at home and welcome I love her.

"The Best" I've been there about 8 times since 10/2017 which is when I first had the fried jumbo shrimp appetizer (4 huge shrimp) the size of the average lady's palm for $15.99.   I noticed with each visit they have gotten much smaller and the price remains the same.  It would be greatly appreciated  if the owner would accommodate her customers by adding at least an additional shrimp when her shrimp are not jumbo.  Overall, the food is GREAT!!

Incredible. We are so lucky to have all of this history still preserved and so loved in the city. Fascinating social history presentation, wonderfully presented and with Passion for a very small fee. If you're like me and having been since you were young go again and expect to go often.
Very awesome place to go and kill an hour or 2. Learned a lot and the guide was very educated and taught us tons of interesting things about life in the 1800s.

I Googled fun things to do in Fredericksburg, and this was one of the top items to pop up. It was a nice little afternoon adventure. It is a small place, but the hostesses know a great deal of history and are very sweet. Several great stories, interesting facts, and you learn quite a bit on where several phrases we still use today came from.
Unique look into tavern life in the 1800s. Staff were knowledgeable and friendly
Fantastic history lesson and tour.

Just like the one at home. They have huge screens and are a good size for large parties. They can accommodate a large group. Please call in advance for large parties. Good selection at the bar, all your favorite drinks and some local brew. I went back the next day and was treated just as good. I liked the service and the staff was really trying to get me everything I asked for.

The food is set by the company, and the back end fulfills their end of the deal by making great, casual food. However, the front end customer service leaves something to be desired. Too long to come back to table. Little menu knowledge (this has been on three occasions in the past month). If you want to watch the game and dont care about customer service, then 5 stars.
The patron was very attentive and very helpful. The appetizers were delicious and the pulled pork sandwich could have used less salt but overall good. There were no images due to the gobbled up food.
The food was good but what made the experience even better was our server!! She was amazing... just wished I could remember her name.  I would hire her in a heartbeat

Atmosphere is their main attraction. The wings are ok. Let's face it you go for the drinks and sports.  However the burger never disappoints.  Bloody Mary could use some tweaking.  I've had better. Can't mess up the draft drinks. Service is slow so order a drink before you get to the glass half-empty.
